Key Match Events: Ghana lost 1-2 to Cape Verde in the Africa Cup of Nations group stage match on January 14, 2024.
Djiku scored two goals for Ghana in the 56th and 10th minutes.
Monteiro scored for Cape Verde in the 17th minute.
Rodrigues scored for Cape Verde in the 90+2' and 90+3' minutes.
Baba, Paintsil, and Djiku received yellow cards for Ghana, while Duarte, Rocha Santos, and Rodrigues received yellow cards for Cape Verde.
Pre-Game Insights: Ghana is seeking to outdo their ignominious exit from the 2021 Africa Cup of Nations and win their fifth title.
Cape Verde hopes to surpass expectations and make a strong showing in the tournament.
Ghana has been unconvincing in recent matches and must perform at a higher level to avoid early exits.
Cape Verde has a strong team with eight different goalscorers in qualifying and is unpredictable.
Ghana's Mohammed Kudus is anticipated to carry the can for the team, while Cape Verde's Bubista is expected to utilize a 4-3-3 formation.
Post-Match Reflections: Ghana's Chris Hughton stated that the team will review their performance and make necessary adjustments for the next match.
Cape Verde's Bubista expressed satisfaction with the team's performance and confidence in their ability to navigate the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ghana's Thomas Partey is out due to injury, and Inaki Williams will lead the attack for the team.
Cape Verde does not have any reported injuries and will start with a 4-3-3 formation.
Others: The match was played at the Stade de l'Amitie, with Ghana facing a tough draw and pressure to secure maximum points.
Ghana's form has been inconsistent, with a mix of wins and losses in recent matches.
Cape Verde has made it out of the group twice in three appearances at the Africa Cup of Nations finals.
